item.description:
Whenever I see photos of someone at a food festival or a food court and all the food they ate, I assume they only took one or two bites, since it‚Äôs almost always an incredible amount of food that one person can‚Äôt possibly eat on their own. https://t.co/UJ0Tpoyj0u

I also think: ‚ÄúShould I bother going? I‚Äôve had a pretty good experience just looking at the photos of of the food.‚Äù

I think the same thing when I see people posting their travel photos. ‚ÄúWhy bother going now? I‚Äôm just going to see the same things I already saw.‚Äù
item.source:markdown:

I also think: ‚ÄúShould I bother going? I‚Äôve had a pretty good experience just looking at the photos of of the food.‚Äù
I think the same thing when I see people posting their travel photos. ‚ÄúWhy bother going now? I‚Äôm just going to see the same things I already saw.‚Äù

item.description: Us Torontonians can put plastic bags in the recycling, just not black plastic of any kind. It‚Äôs the main reason I bring a reusable container if I think I‚Äôm not going to finish my meal at a restaurant. https://t.co/gcV3wMje0h

item.description: @Bill2K MLB does recaps (3-4 minute highlight packages) and the 7-8 minute condensed games, and they‚Äôre really good, but they‚Äôre still never as good as Blue Jays in 30. It feels like something to make time for and eat snacks while watching.
item.source:markdown: @Bill2K MLB does recaps (3-4 minute highlight packages) and the 7-8 minute condensed games, and they‚Äôre really good, but they‚Äôre still never as good as Blue Jays in 30. It feels like something to make time for and eat snacks while watching.

item.description:
After every Toronto Blue Jays game, Sportsnet (the TV network owned by the same parent company as the baseball team) produces a half-an-hour distillation called Blue Jays in 30. I want that for every event that‚Äôs 3 hours or longer.

One downside is you won‚Äôt be able to participate in the conversation about it live. Another downside is having to spend a day avoiding spoilers.

I would watch a ‚Äú2022 Emmys in 30‚Äù if NBC produced it. #Emmys2022

I would watch a ‚ÄúDay Of Mourning for Queen Elizabeth II in 30‚Äù (for each day of mourning) if someone produced it.

I would have watched a ‚ÄúJanuary 6th Committee Hearing in 30‚Äù (for each of the hearings) if the committee had produced them.
item.source:markdown:
After every Toronto Blue Jays game, Sportsnet (the TV network owned by the same parent company as the baseball team) produces a half-an-hour distillation called Blue Jays in 30. I want that for every event that‚Äôs 3 hours or longer.
One downside is you won‚Äôt be able to participate in the conversation about it live. Another downside is having to spend a day avoiding spoilers.
I would watch a ‚Äú2022 Emmys in 30‚Äù if NBC produced it. #Emmys2022
I would watch a ‚ÄúDay Of Mourning for Queen Elizabeth II in 30‚Äù (for each day of mourning) if someone produced it.
I would have watched a ‚ÄúJanuary 6th Committee Hearing in 30‚Äù (for each of the hearings) if the committee had produced them.

item.description: This tweet, now deleted, was about how, when guys talk to each other, it‚Äôs only ever one guy talking about himself and then the other guy talking about himself, as if they were comparing their resumes.

item.description: @Planta It was still a bit Shakespearean, and the plot was almost exactly the same as House of Cards: To Play the King (except in this case, Diana is a ghost and not still alive). Which is to say, I liked it.
